page.title: 03OUR SHORELINE
page.content: { The shoreline along our area is mainly composed of headlands,about 3 to 5 metres high,and bayhead beaches. The shore is very rocky and there is a lot of seaweed.The beaches are mainly broken down shells and pebbles.The water is very polluted due to the power station and factories on the opposite shore and to leakages from the many tankers passing along the sealane. Offshore there is a wave cut platform of hard rock covered with small stones where the coast has been worn back. There is also a former blow-hole channel, about 3.5 metres tall and 1 metre wide,where the top has collapsed There is a number of small streams which have flowed down the hillside and into the sea, but none is more than about l metre wide. (CONTINUED)
